metadata.title: CVE-2016-1968 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer underflow in Brotli, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 45.0, allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(buffer overflow) via crafted data with brotli compression.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1968` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

brotli - 0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python-brotli - 0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python3-brotli - 0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '45.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
brotli package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
